text: today I'm making a tried and true brunch
classic for you guys it's broccoli
cheddar quiche who could say no to that
it's a fantastic dish for kind of any
time but it's great to serve a crowd
because well each quiche serves about
eight people you can make it ahead and
it's really simple to put together
I'm rolling up my pie crust to start off
with this is a homemade pie crust you
can find my recipe and a video for it
right here on this channel take the time
and make your own it's really easy and I
have great directions on how to do it
should be about an eighth of an inch
thick I like to roll turn roll turn to
keep my crust round and then it can be
transferred right to your 9 inch pie
plate fit your dough in I want to trim
my edges just a tiny bit so that they're
even I like to use scissors I think this
is the best tool a lot of people use a
paring knife and that works as well I
think I have more control with scissors
fold your dough underneath sort of
pinching to seal okay and then you can
crimp this however you want I'm going to
flute it so just take your thumb and
your forefinger and then in your second
forefinger and just press it in and
that's how you go around most important
thing I think in making quiche is to
blind bake your crust so that the crust
is nice fully cooked and golden brown
and not soggy if you do this step and
blind-bake your crust your quiche will
be perfect every time I like to chill
this crust before I blind bake it so get
it into the refrigerator for a few
minutes like 10 or 15 minutes maybe the
freezer even so when your crust is
chilled just a bit line it with
parchment paper and then fill with pie
weights I like to film my pies almost
completely to the top if not to the top
because this is what holds your crust in
place as it's starting to bake if
there's nothing there holding it in
place it'll just sink down and then your
crust will be all uneven so fill it
really nice and full and then get it
into it
375 degree oven you want to bake it
until the edges are set and turning
golden that can take 20 to 30 minutes
and then remove the parchment paper and
the beans and let it cook until it's
light golden brown on the bottom that
will take about five to ten more minutes
while your crust is baking you can get
your filling ready you'll need about 2
cups of diced onion so either one large
onion or two smaller onions should yield
about two cups quiche are another great
make-ahead brunch or breakfast meal you
can make this the day before and if you
like your quiche warm I don't actually
like it warm but if you do you can just
reheat the slices a little bit before
you serve them so they get a little bit
warmer just be careful that you don't
leave them in too long and they burn and
they're great use of leftovers you can
always throw anything you want into a
key kind of like a frittata I'm a fan
you know it's more dangerous in the
kitchen than a sharp knife a dull knife
ha ha that's totally true though you
have to have a sharp knife if you don't
it can slip and cut you and that cut
will be even more painful than if it
were a sharp knife but you're far less
likely to cut yourself if your knife is
properly sharpened okay that can get set
aside you can make your egg mixture 6
large eggs this quiche is full of
vegetables it doesn't have a ton ton of
eggs for a 9-inch pie plate but it's got
a nice amount of broccoli twists now I'm
gonna add some cream it's 3/4 of a cup
of heavy cream you could use milk it
totally works this is a little bit more
rich a little bit more celebratory I
guess but go ahead and use cold milk if
you want to Wow
then add 3/4 of a pound of broccoli
these have been steamed already they're
already in florets and a cup of grated
cheddar cheese white is fine I like
extra sharp that's just my preference
almost all the time 1/2 teaspoon of
coarse salt and quarter teaspoon of
pepper one last thing that you want to
do is saute those onions I don't like
raw onions in my mixtures so I'm going
to go ahead and saute those now in a
large skillet melt about a tablespoon of
butter I won't tell if you use two
tablespoons and then add your onion you
can cook this until it's translucent and
maybe a little bit of gold in this
around the edges it doesn't have to be
fully caramelized when your onions are
done you can grab your crust out of the
oven
hopefully the timing was perfect but you
can always take your crust out of the
oven a little ahead of time and if it
cools a little it's okay it's really
nice and golden which makes me super
happy that's a perfectly cooked crust
for quiche add your onions to your
mixture you could let it cool down just
a little bit so it doesn't start cooking
your eggs a safer bet mix your onions
into your egg mixture and then this all
gets poured right into your pre baked
crust this pre-baked crust is going to
make the bottom crust of your quiche
perfectly cooked it will not be soggy at
all you can see this is a lot of
broccoli and not a ton of eggs so it's
going to be really good and quite
healthy for you get this back into the
oven and cook it until it's set in the
center that should take about 40 to 45
more minutes when the quiche comes out
of the oven of course you want to let it
cool for at least an hour before you
serve it and you can refrigerate it
overnight if you want to you can always
reheat it I can hear that the crust is
nice and crunchy on the bottom which
makes me super happy because I really
get depressed when crusts are
underbanked and this is perfect it's
golden-brown its crispy it's crunchy mmm
